text.text_translated: Asteroids are rocks in space. Some are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids'. They travel near Earth's path around the sun. They come closer than 7.5 million kilometres. NASA made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. But NASA says they are not a problem for the next 100 years. NASA has technology to watch these rocks. They can see if a rock is going to hit Earth. If there is a problem, NASA has two plans to stop it.
